data.title: Great Place to Get the Wiggles Out
data.text: The Imagination Station was a great place to take my 18 month old! They have an art room with all sorts of craft supplies available, an area for infants to crawl around and explore, an indoor playhouse with play food and kitchen-and an upstairs to climb up, a whole other room with story books, a puppet stage, and dress up costumes to play with. It's great because the building is located in the middle of a fenced-in park with sidewalk games, swings, slides, and other playground equipment - so rain or shine there's plenty to do. Their hours are limited because it is volunteer run, so I'd recommend checking their website for the most up-to-date opening times. They also list special programming and story times on their website. We were able to catch a special story time that had crafts and treats afterwards all included in their entrance fee of $10/family (up to 3 kids).  The price seemed reasonable since it is a non-profit and all the proceeds go towards improving the museum.
